comments.body:
The tests don't assert on the value of the annotations.  If you change this to just the following line:

```go
ep.Labels["foo"] = "bar"
```

then the update will succeed but we never look at the annotation values that should be propagated.

For example:

```diff
diff --git a/test/integration/endpointslice/endpointslicemirroring_test.go b/test/integration/endpointslice/endpointslicemirroring_test.go
index 409e60a7368..e0ad8fbf260 100644
--- a/test/integration/endpointslice/endpointslicemirroring_test.go
+++ b/test/integration/endpointslice/endpointslicemirroring_test.go
@@ -273,7 +273,8 @@ func TestEndpointSliceMirroringUpdates(t *testing.T) {
                {
                        testName: "Update annotations",
                        tweakEndpoint: func(ep *corev1.Endpoints) {
-                               ep.Annotations["foo2"] = "bar2"
+                               // ep.Annotations["foo2"] = "bar2"
+                               ep.Labels["foo"] = "bar"
                        },
                },
                {
```

```sh
$ pwd
/Users/amcdermo/go-projects/kube/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/integration/endpointslice
$ go test
...
PASS
I0118 11:08:58.852269   80756 etcd.go:140] etcd exit status: signal: killed
ok  	k8s.io/kubernetes/test/integration/endpointslice	21.721s
$ echo $? 
0

weÂ´ve talked offline, the test logic is testing behaviour independently of the inputs.
So the test_cases inputs are the ones that defines what is being tested.

Somehow I'd thought we already had a helper func for this but I can't find it. We do have an [identically named function in admission](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/plugin/pkg/admission/podnodeselector/admission.go#L263) though...
yeah, there is no good library to deal with annotations and labels, labels have some utils, maybe is a good first issue to create this in apimachinery tools
